text:
Is there a way to change the text in the navigation based on what language is selected?

I've created my main menu via settings > navigation which is in English. However, when a user changes the language, let's say to French, I want the text in my main menu to be French.

Is there a way to do this without having to create multiple main menu's for each language?

<@U7SL518D6> i am doing the practicum excersize. problem im facing is , i cannot center align the module group. is it possible ?
ive made a group of logo and menu. but when i apply css to center align it does not apply. if i apply it separately to menue it does.

Wondering if someone out there could help me better understand adding redirect urls to HubSpot.

Heres the situation.  i have three sites that are being combined into one <http://domain.com|domain.com>, <http://domain.fr|domain.fr>, and <http://domain.de|domain.de> are all going to be living under <http://domain.com|domain.com> with translations at <http://domain.com/fr|domain.com/fr> and <http://domain.com/de|domain.com/de>.

If I add <http://domain.fr|domain.fr> and <http://domain.de|domain.de> as "redirect URLs" will I then be able to use url mapping to map say <http://domain.fr|domain.fr> to <http://domain.com/fr|domain.com/fr>?
I don't believe there is a way to do that.  I've always had to create multiple main menus for each language

Hey everyone, I had a simple question that may be kind of silly. I'm working on a pillar page and I can't seem to get the back button to work as it normally does where it takes you to the previous page. In looking at examples of other people's pillar pages I'm noticing that they disable the back button altogether
can someone shed some light into this?
was it opened in a new tab?
has anyone ever had this in the unsubscribe url for an email <http://site.com|site.com> `/hs/manage-preferences/unsubscribe-test?`

Is there anyway to mix and match subdomains as part of a site seach for instance searching www and blog subdomains? My initial tests don't seem to work, but maybe its possibleto add multiple domain parameters to the URL
Check out <#C9LPMCT35|site-search-feedback> but a lot is possible through the API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
Thanks I've been using that. It seems that adding &domain=<http://www.mysite.com|www.mysite.com>  makes no difference in results for some reason
I can put &domain= <http://www.pizza.com|www.pizza.com> and results stay the same
But the other parameters work fine.. not sure if tha param is broken or not
On the result page can you pull up the network tab and see the request made to `/_hcms/search`?
And make sure the query params are what you expect
Yes I can see the params  for type, domain, etc, just can't filter by them with the params for some reason
Only one that works is pathPrefix for some reason
Is the show dependents feature not working properly for anyone else?
<https://spin.d.pr/qpwF9B>
all of the pages listed do not appear to have the module on them
Seems to be working for me
Want to DM me a link to where you are seeing this?
sure
